arm_group.description: 80min IV infusion of a low-dose pain medication
80min IV infusion of a saline placebo

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine how pain relief is modified when the investigators
      combine the Virtual Reality based Snow World game with certain pain medications.

clinical_study.brief_title: Modifying Virtual Reality Analgesia With Low-Dose Pain Medication

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, within subject 2x2 factorial,
      repeated measures study. Research participants will play two versions of the Virtual Reality
      based video game "Snow World" and be given thermal and electrical stimulus. Each of two
      study visits will be identical with the exception of whether or not the participant will
      receive an iv infusion of a low dose pain medication or a saline placebo.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Healthy male and females between the age of 18 and 60 years

          -  Ability to communicate orally

          -  Ability to read and understand English

          -  Body Mass Index between 20-35

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Women who are pregnant, trying to become pregnant, or who are breastfeeding

          -  History of alcohol or substance abuse

          -  Major medical illness; including history of migraine headaches, seizures, brain
             injury, or peripheral neuropathy

          -  Current use of analgesics including acetaminophen, non-steroidal anti-inflammatories,
             or opioids

          -  Predisposition to severe motion sickness

          -  Unusual sensitivity or lack of sensitivity to pain

          -  Urine toxicology positive for opioids or benzodiazepines

intervention.intervention_name: Low-dose pain medication (Ketalar) and saline placebo

clinical_study.official_title: Modifying Virtual Reality Analgesia With Low-Dose Pain Medication

primary_outcome.measure: Pain responses between placebo and the low-dose pain medication while playing Snow World. We will assess pain responses with subjective questionnaires concerning the participant's experience while playing Snow World.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Conclusion of 120 study visits. Each participant will spend a total of 8 hours with us.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Supportive Care
